entry.title: Two Portland residents receive Oregon's top urban forestry honors along with City of Wilsonville (Photo)
entry.summary: PORTLAND, Ore. – The non-profit organization Oregon Community Trees (OCT) is honoring Portland residents Ryan Gilpin and Bruce Nelson and the City of Wilsonville for their work on behalf of urban trees. Gilpin and Nelson are receiving awards for their individual contributions to urban forestry, and Wilsonville is getting the award in the Organizations category. “Every year Oregon Community Trees recognizes individuals and organizations that are doing outstanding work to help our urban forests,” said OCT President Tyler Roth. “This year’s recipients’ are especially deserving for the depth and breadth of their commitment to educating people about urban trees and promoting policies and actions to keep those trees healthy and well cared for.” Gilpin, who lives in North Portland’s St. Johns nei…

entry.title: Tangent becomes Oregon's newest Tree City USA (Photo)
entry.summary:
TANGENT, Ore. – Just in time for Oregon Arbor Month, the Oregon Department of Forestry (ODF) is announcing that the city of Tangent in Linn County has earned the Tree City USA designation. ODF administers the program for the national Arbor Day Foundation, based in Nebraska. Tangent joins 68 other communities in Oregon that hold the Tree City USA designation. Brittany Oxford, ODF Urban and Community Assistance Forester, says to earn the designation, a city or town must meet four criteria:
Maintain a tree board or department Have a community tree ordinance Spend at least $2 per capita on urban forestry Celebrate Arbor Day each year
In 2023, during Tangent's 50-year celebration, the Park Commission was renamed the Park & Tree Board to promote the city's efforts to maintain parks and trees. The city council unanimously approved new tree care ordinances, and the Mayor signed a proclamation recognizing Arbor Day during a celebration with food trucks and community members gathering to celebrate. For 2024, the City of Tangent again plans to recognize Arbor Day. City staff are looking forward to using TreePlotter Inventory software to catalog all public trees and invite the public to come out and volunteer to help. Along with plotting trees, the city is looking at planting new trees along two parks this year and encouraging residents to be aware of the importance of tree maintenance and reporting tree health concerns. The Tree City USA program dates to 1976, when the first group of 42 cities in 16 states were named. Today, more than 3,600 communities across the country and located in every state and Puerto Rico hold the distinction.

entry.title: Committee for Family Forestlands meets March 21
entry.summary:
SALEM, Ore. — The Committee for Family Forestlands will meet virtually on Thursday, March 21 from 11 a.m. to 3 p.m. To join virtually, please use the Zoom video conference information found on the agenda. The committee’s agenda includes:
Forest Resources Division update Fire Protection funding and fire map discussion Communication efforts with SFOs Vote for term renewals Board of Forestry update Forest genetics and climate change Agenda topics discussion
The meeting is open to the public to attend online via Zoom. Public comments will be accepted near the start of the meeting. Requests for an interpreter for the hearing impaired or other accommodations for persons with disabilities should be made at least 24 hours before the meeting by emailing committee.of.family.forestlands@odf.oregon.gov. The 13-member committee researches policies that affect family forests, natural resources and forestry benefits. Based on its findings, the committee recommends actions to the Oregon Board of Forestry and the State Forester. View more information on the CFF webpage.

entry.summary: March 19, 2024 3:45 a.m. Douglas Timber Operators will have its monthly no-host breakfast meeting on Thursday March 28th. Lone Rock Timber President Joe Newton will be the speaker. His presentation is titled, “Lone Rock Business and Our Solution for Forestry in Southwest Oregon”. The event will be held at 8:00 a.m. at The Loft...

entry.title: Douglas County Fairgrounds gets awarded
entry.summary: ROSEBURG — Douglas County Fairgrounds received four awards at the Western Fair Association's 2024 Convention and Trade Show in Anaheim, California.

entry.title: COUNTY PIER SELECTION GRANT REVIEW/APPLICANT PRESENTATIONS
entry.summary: March 19, 2024 3:35 a.m. The Douglas County Board of Commissioners in conjunction with the Douglas County PIER Selection Committee have scheduled a special meeting for the Douglas County Planning, Infrastructure, and Economic Revitalization Program Disaster Grant Program on Monday March 25th. The meeting will begin at 2:00 p.m. in room 216 of the courthouse...

entry.title: LIBRARY OFFERS READ FOR BURGERS SPRING PROGRAM
entry.summary: March 19, 2024 3:25 a.m. Roseburg Public Library is participating with In-N-Out Burger in their Cover to Cover Club reading program through Saturday April 13th. A City release said local children ages 4 to 12 are invited to participate in the program. A Roseburg Public Library card is not required. Parents and children may pick...

entry.title: UMPQUA OREGON HUNTERS ASSOCIATRION BANQUET IS APRIL 6TH
entry.summary: March 19, 2024 3:15 a.m. The Umpqua Oregon Hunters Association has its 24th annual banquet on April 6th at Seven Feathers Casino Resort. Doors open at 4:00 p.m. with dinner at 6:00 p.m. Raffles and an auction starts at 6:30 p.m. Tickets are $115 for members and $150 for nonmembers. To get tickets, email: oha.umpqua.treasurer@gmail.com...

entry.title: BOWLING 4 BIG IMPACT FUNDRAISER APRIL 11TH
entry.summary: March 19, 2024 3:05 a.m. Greater Roseburg Young Life will hold their second annual Bowling 4 Big Impact Club and Camp Fundraiser on Thursday April 11th. The event will run from 6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. at Ten Down Bowling on Northeast Diamond Lake Boulevard. Sponsored teams and students will bowl to raise money for...

entry.title: CONGRESSMAN BENTZ ENDORSES MONIQUE DESPAIN
entry.summary: March 19, 2024 2:50 a.m. On Monday, Congressman Cliff Bentz announced his endorsement of candidate Monique DeSpain. Bentz said, “I am proud to endorse retired Air Force Colonel Monique DeSpain to represent Oregon’s Fourth Congressional District”. Bentz said, “Monique brings outstanding experience with her many years as a senior officer in the United States Air...
